title: Magnetism - compare field at two points

content.question:
A bar magnet creates a magnetic field. Points <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> are equal distances on either side of the bar magnet, as shown. Which of the following best relates the magnitude of the magnetic field strengths <math alttext="B sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="B sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></math> at points <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> respectively, and whether the directions of the magnetic field at points <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> are the same or different?
MagnitudeDirectionA<math alttext="B sub X is greater than, B sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>SameB<math alttext="B sub X is greater than, B sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>OppositeC<math alttext="B sub X equals, B sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>OppositeD<math alttext="B sub X equals, B sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>Same

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
